p: The 994 OTUs classified into 11 phyla with highly variable relative abundances among the cod individuals and treatment levels (Fig. 4a) [see Additional file 11]. A single abundant OTU was classified by a different method than the rest of the OTUs as described in an additional file [see Additional file 12]. The phylum Proteobacteria represented 45% (263 OTUs) of the sequences in the 12 cod samples, followed by the phyla Deferribacteres (20%, 1 OTU), Bacteroidetes (11%, 186 OTUs) and Fusobacteria (8%, 45 OTUs). Proteobacteria dominated 4 out of 6 GI communities in the lower exposure group and 2 out of 6 in the upper exposure group. The remaining two lower exposure samples, 44 and 45, were dominated by Bacteroidetes or Tenericutes, respectively. Phylum Deferribacterales had the largest relative abundance in the datasets obtained from the remaining 4 upper exposure samples (49, 50, 57 and 58). Firmicutes were present in relatively high abundance among lower exposure samples and in upper sample 49. Fusobacteria showed a similar trend with having high relative abundance in only one upper exposure sample, 59.
